name: Fractions — Word Problems with Operations, Decimals & Percents

problems.q: A pancake recipe uses $\tfrac{3}{4}$ cup of milk per batch. If you make $2\tfrac{1}{2}$ batches, how many cups of milk do you need in total?
A jug contains $2\tfrac{3}{5}$ liters of juice. If $\tfrac{7}{8}$ liter is poured out, how much juice remains?
A hiker completes $\tfrac{5}{8}$ of a trail in the morning and $\tfrac{1}{5}$ in the afternoon. What fraction of the trail is still not hiked by the end of the day?
A project requires $2\tfrac{1}{2}$ gallons of sealant. Each can contains $\tfrac{3}{4}$ gallon. How many whole cans must be purchased?
A ribbon of length $1\tfrac{1}{2}$ meters is cut into pieces of length $\tfrac{3}{10}$ meter each. How many pieces are made?
In a class of $30$ students, $40\%$ brought a snack. Of the rest, $\tfrac{1}{3}$ bought from the cafeteria. How many students brought something to eat?
A soup recipe calls for $\tfrac{2}{3}$ cup of broth. You decide to make a $\tfrac{3}{5}$ batch. How much broth is needed?
Write $\tfrac{17}{30}$ as a decimal to the thousandths place (rounded).
A batting average is displayed as $0.\overline{027}$. Express this as a fraction in lowest terms.
An item priced at $48$ is discounted by $12\tfrac{1}{2}\%$ and then taxed at $13\%$. What is the final price (in dollars), to the nearest cent?
Alice ran $0.68$ of a route, while Bob ran $\tfrac{2}{3}$ of the same route. By what fraction of the route did the person who ran more exceed the other?
A course grade is the weighted average of two terms: $\tfrac{1}{4}$ from Term 1 (score $88\%$) and $\tfrac{3}{4}$ from Term 2 (score $92\%$). What is the final percentage score?
Three pizzas are on the table. One is $\tfrac{3}{8}$ eaten, another is $\tfrac{5}{12}$ eaten, and the third is $\tfrac{1}{4}$ eaten. Altogether, how many pizzas remain uneaten?
A tank is $\tfrac{2}{3}$ full. Then $10\%$ of the tank’s total capacity is added. What fraction of the tank is full afterward?
In a club the ratio of boys to girls is $12:15$. What fraction of the club members are boys?
A chemist mixes $\tfrac{1}{3}$ liter, $\tfrac{3}{8}$ liter, and $\tfrac{2}{5}$ liter of three solutions. How many liters are in the mixture altogether?
Sam paints $\tfrac{3}{5}$ of a fence per day. After $1.6$ days of work, what fraction of the fence remains unpainted?
Five friends split $\tfrac{3}{4}$ of a pizza equally. What fraction of a pizza does each friend receive?
A car uses $15$ liters of fuel to travel $210$ km. Express the fuel usage in liters per kilometer as a fraction in lowest terms.
A rectangular garden is $\tfrac{4}{5}$ of a unit long and $\tfrac{5}{6}$ of a unit wide. What fraction of a square unit is its area?
A string is $\tfrac{3}{4}$ meter long. If $0.29$ meter is cut off, how long is the remaining piece?
A baker has $1\tfrac{3}{4}$ kilograms of flour. Each loaf requires $0.4$ kilogram. How many whole loaves can be made, and how much flour remains (in kg)?
In a survey, $37.5\%$ of respondents prefer option A. Express this percentage as a fraction in simplest form.
A spinner lands on red with probability $0.375$. Express this probability as a fraction in lowest terms.
A quality check shows a defect rate of $0.\overline{36}$. Express this repeating decimal as a fraction in lowest terms.
A length is $\tfrac{11}{32}$ meter. Using long division, write this length as a decimal.

A $1$-liter bottle of juice is partially consumed. On Monday, $\tfrac{2}{3}$ of the bottle is drunk. On Tuesday, another $\tfrac{3}{10}$ of the original bottle is drunk. On Wednesday, $\tfrac{1}{4}$ of what remains is drunk. What fraction of the bottle remains?
Find the average (arithmetic mean) of $\tfrac{1}{2}$, $\tfrac{3}{5}$, and $\tfrac{3}{4}$.
One lap around a track takes a jogger $2.4$ minutes at a steady pace. How much of a lap does the jogger complete in $2$ minutes?
On Monday, $\tfrac{1}{5}$ of a class is absent. Later, $30\%$ of those absent return. What fraction of the entire class remains absent?
A bill of $45$ dollars has $13\%$ tax added, then a $15\%$ tip is applied to the post-tax amount. What is the total amount due (in dollars), to the nearest cent?
A recipe uses $\tfrac{1}{2}$ cup of sugar, $0.375$ cup of syrup, and $0.125$ cup of honey. How many cups are used in total?

A cyclist rides $\tfrac{5}{6}$ of a route, then turns back $\tfrac{1}{4}$ of the route’s total length, then rides forward another $\tfrac{1}{12}$. What is the cyclist’s net position from the starting point, and what total distance did the cyclist travel?
problems.answer: \text{Net }=\tfrac{2}{3}\text{ of the route from start; Total distance }=\tfrac{7}{6}\text{ of the route}

problems.q: A rope is $9\tfrac{3}{5}$ meters long. It is cut into equal pieces each $1\tfrac{1}{5}$ meters long. How many pieces are there?
A solution is $30\%$ acid. After adding water to triple the total volume, what fraction of the new solution is acid?
A student watches $\tfrac{5}{12}$ of a $96$-minute movie. How many minutes did the student watch?
Pipe A fills a tank at $\tfrac{1}{3}$ tank per hour and Pipe B at $\tfrac{1}{6}$ tank per hour. If both are opened for $1.5$ hours, what fraction of the tank is filled?
Which is larger, $0.63$ or $\tfrac{5}{8}$? By how much is it larger, expressed as a common fraction?
A gauge reads $1.\overline{27}$ liters. Express this amount as an improper fraction of a liter in lowest terms.
Write $\tfrac{7}{15}$ as a decimal to the thousandths place (rounded).
